modules.description: This module implements password hashing and verification using the Argon2d algorithm. It provides functions to generate raw or encoded hashes with configurable time, memory, and parallelism costs, and supports converting hash outputs to string representations. It is used to securely store and validate user passwords in authentication systems.

This module defines error codes returned by the Argon2 library during password hashing and verification operations. It includes specific variants for invalid input parameters, memory allocation issues, and mismatches in cryptographic outputs. The `message` function maps each error code to a human-readable string for debugging or user feedback.

This module hashes passwords using the Argon2id algorithm, producing either raw or encoded hash outputs. It operates on strings for passwords and salts, with configurable time, memory, and parallelism parameters. It supports password verification against encoded hashes and conversion of hash values to string representations.

This module hashes passwords using the Argon2i algorithm, producing either raw or encoded hash outputs. It provides functions to verify passwords against encoded hashes and convert hash values to strings. It works with strings for passwords and salts, and custom types for raw and encoded hashes. Use cases include secure password storage and verification in authentication systems.

This module performs password hashing and verification using the Argon2 algorithm, supporting the Argon2i, Argon2d, and Argon2id variants. It works with strings for passwords and salts, and produces raw or encoded hash outputs with configurable time, memory, and parallelism parameters. Concrete use cases include securely storing user passwords with encoded hashes and verifying login attempts against stored values in authentication systems.
